title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Avian Influenza (Precautionary
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Avian Influenza (Precautionary 
Confinement of Birds) Regulations 2020 and come into operation on 21 
December 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited avian influenza (precautionary confinement birds) regulation 2020 come operation 21 december 2020

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: In these Regulations:
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations: 

“poultry” means birds kept in captivity for the production of meat or eggs for 
consumption, the production of other products, for restocking supplies of game 
birds or for the purposes of breeding for the production of these categories of 
birds; 

“other captive bird” means a bird other than poultry that is kept in captivity; 

“secure building” means a building where poultry or other captive birds are 
confined in a manner that they cannot come into contact with wild birds.
text_norm: 2 regulation poultry mean bird kept captivity production meat egg consumption production product restocking supply game bird purpose breeding production category bird captive bird mean bird poultry kept captivity secure building mean building poultry captive bird confined manner cannot come contact wild bird

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: 3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her
text_raw:
3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her 
possession or under his or her control shall take all reasonable steps to confine 
such poultry or captive birds – 

(a) 

in a secure building in accordance with the biosecurity measures 
set out in Schedule 1, or 

(b) where it is not possible to confine poultry or other captive birds 
within a secure building, to confine them in a manner that they do 
not have access to other poultry, other captive birds or wild birds, 
in accordance with the biosecurity measures in Schedule 1.
text_norm: 3 (1) person poultry captive bird possession control shall take reasonable step confine poultry captive bird - (a) secure building accordance biosecurity measure set schedule 1 (b) possible confine poultry captive bird within secure building confine manner access poultry captive bird wild bird accordance biosecurity measure schedule 1

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: 4. Regulation 3 is a penal provision to which section 36 (4) (b) of the
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3 is a penal provision to which section 36 (4) (b) of the 

Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 applies. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [663] 3 

Schedule 1 

Biosecurity measures 

All necessary measures to reduce the movement of people, vehicles or 
equipment to and from areas where poultry or captive birds are kept. 

All necessary measures to minimise the risk that poultry or other captive birds 
will become affected with avian influenza through exposure to manure, slurry or 
other products. 

Effective vermin control, including preventing the entry of wild and domestic 
animals to buildings where poultry or captive birds are kept. 

Feed and bedding must be stored in such a manner that other animals do not have 
access. 

A person who has contact with poultry or other captive birds must take all 
reasonable measures to avoid the transfer of avian influenza virus to or from 
buildings where poultry or other captive birds are kept, including cleansing and 
disinfection of equipment, vehicles and footwear that has been in contact with 
poultry or other captive birds. 

Provide at all entry and exit points of land or premises where poultry or captive 
birds are kept, disinfection points containing sufficient amount of a disinfectant 
that is effective against avian influenza virus used in accordance with the 
manufacturer’s guidelines. 

All necessary measures must be taken to prevent access by wild birds to 
buildings where poultry or captive birds are kept. 

Provide feed and water to poultry or captive birds in such a way that is not 
accessible to wild birds. 

Take all necessary measures to prevent over-growth of vegetation or 
accumulation of uncovered water on land or premises, 

Remove from land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept any 
thing that might attract wild birds from the premises such as fallen fruit or 
uneaten feed, 

Take all necessary measures to thoroughly clean and disinfect buildings and 
equipment at the end of each production cycle, using a disinfectant that is 
effective against avian influenza viruses at the right concentration. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [663] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

17 December, 2020. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [663] 5

title: Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013), hereby make the following
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the housing of poultry and captive birds as a 
precautionary measure against risk of avian influenza as well as detailing the 
minimum biosecurity measures to be taken. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [663]
